radiographic_examinations.findings: Large inflammatory collection centered in the right lower quadrant, approximately 6.4 x 4.0 cm, likely representing perforated appendicitis with abscess formation. Inflammation of the adjacent colon and terminal ileum is likely reactive. No pneumoperitoneum. Small amount of adjacent low density free pelvic fluid. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. The portal and intra-abdominal systemic vasculature are normal. No abdominal wall hernia.
